sentences.en: "Are you dizzy at all?" he asked her.
sentences.cn: “你是否有点儿头晕呢？”他问她。

sentences.en: Climbing so high made me feel dizzy .
sentences.cn: 爬那么高使我感到头晕目眩。

sentences.en: He came over all dizzy when he stood up.
sentences.cn: 他一站起身就觉得天旋地转。

sentences.en: He drove the car at dizzy speed.
sentences.cn: 他以令人头晕的速度开车.

sentences.en: He felt sick and dizzy and then passed out.
sentences.cn: 他感到恶心、眩晕，然后就昏了过去。

sentences.en: he soon &B{reached the dizzy heights of} his own series.
sentences.cn: 他很快在他这个系列身居高位。

sentences.en: I escalated to the dizzy heights of director's secretary.
sentences.cn: 我升到了总经理秘书这一显赫高位。
我感觉头晕目眩，辨不清方向。
我一阵眩晕，看到的都是重影。

sentences.en: Perhaps it's a good thing that Dizzy retired.
sentences.cn: 迪齐退休或许是件好事。

sentences.en: Riding on a carousel makes you feel dizzy.
She is famed for playing dizzy blondes.
sentences.cn: 她以扮演金发傻妞而闻名。

sentences.en: She started to suffer from dizzy spells (= a short period when you feel dizzy ) .
sentences.cn: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

sentences.en: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
sentences.cn: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。

sentences.en: The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
sentences.cn: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

sentences.en: Why don't you pack in when you feel dizzy?
sentences.cn: 你觉得头晕时,为什么不停止工作?

words.tran_cn: 使人眼花地；头昏眼花地
使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

trans.tran_en: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill
